column4: question is there a reason why when i try sudo apt-cache update it gives me invalid operation?
after you cahnge the sources.list its just apt-cache update right?
reiserfs.  it never did that for me, on a debian box, can't offer any other suggestions though
i gather you typically do a proper shutdown?
so basically, if you could get it "clean" it would probably stay that way again?
have you tried booting in "recovery mode" yet?
well, on the way in, it should fsck for you
if not, the next thing i would try is booting from rescue media, either the livecd or isstall cd, or knoppix or whatever, heh.  then fsck the partition in question, with it NOT mounted
i imagine you may have typoed just now, but be sure you didn't on the filesystem
